security.policy_info_desc1: The default policy will apply to all users in the organization unless they have a higher-priority policy.
security.policy_info_desc2: These users will be exempt from this policy
security.pwd_policy_desc1: A strong password can prevent unauthorized access and reduce security threats. Set up a strong password policy and enforce secure practices in employees.
security.pwd_policy_desc2: Choose from three preset policy strengths, or set up a custom policy.
security.pwd_policy_desc4: Enforce users to periodically change their password.
security.pwd_policy_desc5: Restrict users from reusing recent passwords.
security.mixed_pwd_desc: Enforce users to have both upper and lower case alphabets in their password.
security.refusal_desc: During password change, do not allow users to set their recently used passwords as their new password.
security.mfa_desc: Increase the account security of all users by enforcing a second level of authentication. Use authenticator apps like Google Authenticator or Authy as the second factor.
security.totp_desc: Scan the QR Code in you authenticator app to receive verification codes.
security.web_session_lifetime_desc: Users will automatically be signed out of their accounts after the chosen period.
security.session_desc2: Control how long a user should stay logged in to the application.
